title: Linking Progressivism and Humanistic Educational Philosophies to Indonesia’s Merdeka Curriculum: Mobile Microlearning-Based Teacher Training

context.prior_knowledge: Intermediate-level knowledge and practical experience in the relevant field
context.additional_context: A non-degree short-term training program for pre-service and in-service teachers, emphasizing smartphone-based accessibility and practicality.

learning_goals: They can explain core principles of progressive and humanistic educational philosophies (e.g., student-centered learning, autonomy, social equity).
They can analyze key features of Indonesia’s Merdeka Curriculum (independent learning goals, environmental connectivity, shared decision-making).
Through educational examples in the literary work *Totto-Chan* (novel), they can propose ways to apply progressive and humanistic approaches to actual curricula.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
